[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”CTA Section Title” _builder_version=”3.15″ text_font=”||||” header_font=”Oswald|on||on|” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”60px” header_line_height=”1.3em” background_layout=”dark” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”|||” animation_style=”zoom” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”20%” locked=”off”]

BEST OF EAST EUROPE
7 Days/ 6 Nights

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_divider color=”#ffffff” divider_position=”center” divider_weight=”3px” height=”false” disabled_on=”off|off|off” _builder_version=”3.2″ max_width=”150px” module_alignment=”center” animation_style=”zoom” animation_delay=”200ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”20%” locked=”off”][/et_pb_divider][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|tablet” admin_label=”Packages” _builder_version=”3.9″ custom_padding=”39px||29px||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”0px||0px|”][et_pb_row custom_padding=”30px|0px|53px|0px|false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”60px||0px|” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” admin_label=”Packages Title” _builder_version=”3.0.76″ locked=”off”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″ parallax=”off” parallax_method=”on”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.9″ text_font=”||||” text_text_color=”#1a1a1a” header_font=”Oswald|on||on|” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”60px” header_line_height=”1.3em” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”|||” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”top” animation_intensity_slide=”10%” locked=”off”]

Itinerary

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_divider color=”#ed4441″ divider_position=”center” divider_weight=”3px” height=”false” disabled_on=”off|off|off” _builder_version=”3.2″ max_width=”150px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”30px|||” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”top” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_slide=”10%” locked=”off”][/et_pb_divider][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row admin_label=”Package” _builder_version=”3.0.67″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″ parallax=”off” parallax_method=”on”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Description” _builder_version=”3.15″ text_font=”Roboto||||” text_font_size=”16px” text_line_height=”1.8em” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” animation_style=”zoom” animation_direction=”left” animation_delay=”100ms” animation_intensity_zoom=”10%”]

Day 1:  Munich, Germany

Welcome to Munich – third largest city of Germany. On arrival check into your hotel on your own any time after 1500 hrs. Overnight in Munich. (D) Day 2 Prague, Czech Republic Today, drive to Prague and proceed on a guided city tour. Visit the 1000-year old Hradcany Castle, the former residence of the Bohemian kings and St. Vitus Cathedral and walk on the Charles Bridge. Visit the Old Town Square and see the Astronomical Clock, one of the outstanding sights of Prague. Overnight in Prague. (B, D)

 

Day 2: Prague, Czech Republic

Today, drive to Prague and proceed on a guided city tour. Visit the 1000-year old Hradcany Castle, the former residence of the Bohemian kings and St. Vitus Cathedral and walk on the Charles Bridge. Visit the Old Town Square and see the Astronomical Clock, one of the outstanding sights of Prague. Overnight in Prague. (B, D)

Day 3: Bratislava, Slovakia, Budapest, Hungary

Today, drive to Bratislava, the capital of Slovakia. On an orientation tour visit the Old Town, with its Roland Fountain in the square. You have some free time to soak in the atmosphere of this medieval city, with its side-walk cafes. Later, we drive to Budapest – capital of Hungary. Overnight in Budapest. (B, D)

Day 4: Budapest, Hungary

Today, proceed on a guided panoramic city tour of Budapest. Visit the Buda Castle and see the Chain Bridge, the Parliament and the Opera House. Visit Heroes’ Square – the capital’s most spectacular square with the column of the Millennium Memorial. Visit the Fishermans Bastion – a terrace in neo-Gothic and Neoromanesc style situated on the Buda bank of the Danube for a panoramic view of the Danube, Margaret Island, Pest and the Gellért Hill. Later, evening you have free time at Danube River Point. Overnight in Budapest. (B, D)

 

 

Day 5: Vienna, Austria

Today, drive to Vienna – capital of Austria. On your guided tour, drive on the Ring Boulevard and see the State Opera House, the Parliament, the City Hall and the Burgtheater. We also make a photostop at the Hofburg-former winter residence of the Habsburg family and the Belvedere Palace-former summer residence of Prince Eugene. Overnight in Vienna. (B, D)

 

Day 6: Salzburg, Austria

Today, drive to Salzburg. Upon arrival, proceed on a guided walking tour of Salzburg see the birthplace of the legendary Mozart, the Mirabell Palace with its landscaped gardens and the Cathedral in the old town. Stroll along the Aldstadt, which was recently granted World Heritage Status by UNESCO. Later, we drive to Munich. Overnight in Munich. (B, D)

Day 7: Munich, Germany and Return Home

After a continental breakfast, we check out and take you on an orientation tour of this beautiful city. See Marienplatz, the undisputed center of the city, named after the column of the Virgin Mary at its center. Marienplatz is also famous for its neogothic Town Hall, whose mechanical clock the Glockenspiel plays thrice every day. Later, we drive to the airport for your flight back home. (Return flight to be booked after 2200 hrs). It’s time to say goodbye to all the new friends you have made. We hope you take back many happy memories of your holiday. We would like you to spare a few minutes of your time to write and tell us how you enjoyed your holiday and any suggestions you may have for the future. (B)

Due to operational reasons, the routing of this tour may be changed. However, all the sightseeing will remain the same. Note: Few departures will be operated into Vienna and out of Vienna.
